newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland's Bank Handlowy first listing on June 30.
newsitem.headline: Poland's Bank Handlowy first listing on June 30.

text.p: Poland's Bank Handlowy SA will start trading on the Warsaw bourse's main market on June 30, the bourse's president said on Saturday.

"The first listing of (Bank Handlowy) shares will take place on June 30," Wieslaw Rozlucki told reporters after a special bourse session during which 18.85 million Handlowy shares sold in the retail tranche were formally allotted.
Rozlucki said the bourse would soon decide on the addition of Handlowy shares to 23 stocks currently traded both under the main single-price auction system and in continuos trade.

"We plan to take such a decision (on continuous trade) soon and we want the addition of Handlowy to the continuous trade to take place a week after its debut in the single-price session," Rozlucki said.
Handlowy's public offer of 38.35 million shares priced at 35 zlotys with five- or three-percent discounts for retail investors ended in a heavy oversubscription.
Out of Handlowy's 65 million shares the bourse will list all but a 4,641,000 tranche for employees, who are obliged to keep them for at least three years.
